title: [BUG] `AutoETS` fails to fit some time series accurately
body: **Describe the bug** Inspired by [this issue](https://github.com/Nixtla/hierarchicalforecast/issues/30), we ran some [experiments](https://github.com/Nixtla/hierarchicalforecast/tree/main/experiments/libs-comparison) using the `AutoETS` model. We found that for some unstable series (with outliers, mainly), the forecast performance of this model degrades by many orders of magnitude compared with other implementations (R and `StatsForecast`). I believe the problem is related to the `statsmodels` implementation (https://github.com/statsmodels/statsmodels/issues/8344) (see, for example, the following table using the M4 dataset). As additional preprocessing must be done for this type of unstable series, I think it would be very positive for the users if a warning about the use of the model was included in the documentation, particularly for fitting multiple time series. Our [results](https://github.com/Nixtla/statsforecast/tree/main/experiments/ets) suggest that our version is more robust than current alternatives. If you are interested, I could work on including this version in `sktime`.
